titlestmt.titleproper: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Education Department records 1935-2004 1960s-1990s
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Education Department records

bioghist.p: The Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia was founded in 1812 "for the encouragement and cultivation of the sciences, and the advancement of useful learning." The Education Department conducts field trips and workshops, creates teacher resources on natural history topics, and runs special programs for a variety of audiences.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Education Department of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. The bulk of the records in the collection date from the 1960s to the 1990s and include papers from the offices of James McGonigle, Nancy Peter, and Colleen North. Administrative records include: budgets, personnel and hiring records, attendance logs, phone logs, accident reports, internal correspondence, department annual reports, and minutes from various committees. Program and exhibit records include planning documents, publicity, lesson plans, schedules, student enrollment sheets and surveys, accessibility surveys, photographs of member trips, records of traveling exhibits, and slides of several programs. Programs and activities documented by the collection include WINS (Women in Natural Science), SEEC (Science Enrichment Expansion Curriculum), SEUS (Science Enrichment for Underserved Students), Earth Week, EcoShow on the Road, Action/Motivation, Potentials, Expeditions for Everyone, and the Ludwick Lecture series. A smaller selection of papers date from the 1930s to the 1950s; these include departmental annual reports, brochures and announcements, and exhibit information.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
